title: Video Roundup: Inspiration from Matt Walker, Kate Courtney, Katy Winton and more
content:
There really is no shortage of high quality mountain bike videos floating about the internet at the moment. We’ve gathered four of the best for your viewing pleasure; a Home Run at Fort William from DH World Number 1, Matt Walker, Kate Courtney’s “Rising” following her strength training, the Lapierre-Zipp Collective Team Camp on the Island of Corsica, and One Minute with Katy Winton shredding her home trails in Scotland.

Kate Courtney – Rising

From the SCOTT-SRAM MTB Racing Team:

“Learn how Kate Courtney turned her backyard and garage into a high-performance gym, building a strong foundation towards the new 2021 season. It’s not all mountain biking in Kate’s training schedule. In the gym, Kate’s coach Matt ensures her program develops several key skills that translate onto the bike. From drills challenging balance on the indo board and swiss ball, to proprioception and strength-focused training, all are done to prepare Kate to handle whatever is thrown at her on track.”

Scott-Sports.com

Matt Walker’s Home Run at Fort William Downhill Track

From Madison-Saracen Racing:

“Matt Walker on Madison Saracen would have been rocking number one for his ‘home’ race. Yet again the pandemic has messed up those best laid plans but that didn’t stop Matt heading to the Highlands to take on one of the toughest tracks in the world on its 20th anniversary. Ride with Matt as he follows in the bike tracks of greatness at the one and only Fort William. We also want to send a massive shout out to the Nevis Range for letting us film at the track in challenging circumstances”.

Saracen.co.uk

Lapierre Zipp Collective Team Camp

From the Lapierre Zipp Collective Team:

Now made up of four drivers, the Lapierre Zipp Collective is one of the youngest and most promising teams on the Enduro World Series circuit with an average age of 23. Last March our entire collective left for a team camp exploring the Corsican trails at the handlebars of their Spicy. Through this new video, we wanted to transcribe the ambitions of the team and show the state of mind that prevails within our collective. ‘The Future is Now’ is an invitation to travel, discover and prepare for an upcoming season that we hope will be rich! Welcome to the world of the Lapierre Zipp Collective vintage 2021.

LapierreBikes.com

One Minute with Katy Winton

Here’s one from Katy Winton, the EWS Racer who finished her 2020 season on a high with 4th place in Finale Ligure. Here she is aboard her new Nukeproof Giga, a Super Enduro bike sold only as a 29er. However, 5ft Winton runs hers as a mullet and as you can probably tell, it works for her. See exactly how Katy has it set up here.

From Nukeproof Bikes:

“We’re stoked to be supporting such an awesome athlete in Katy Winton for 2021. We caught up with her “briefly” in the Tweed Valley for a taste of what is to come.”

Nukeproof.com
author: Jessie-May Morgan
